title: Model-Free Learning

definitions.Model-Free Learning: A type of machine learning where the algorithm learns to make decisions based on the current state and the reward received, without building a model of the environment.

formulas: Q-learning formula: Q(s, a) = Q(s, a) + alpha * (reward + gamma * max(Q(s', a)) - Q(s, a))
summary: The slide presents the concept of Model-Free Learning, a machine learning approach where decisions are made based on the current state and received rewards, without constructing a predictive model of the environment. It includes the Q-learning formula, which is central to this learning method.
